interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Bullitt (DVD) (Rpkg) Review Date: 2012/09/07 Store: Steve McQueen (Actor), Robert Vaughn (Actor), Peter Yates (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Action & Adventure Product Description: ['Bullitt (DVD) (Rpkg)', "There are bad cops and there are good cops ... and then there's Bullitt. Steve McQueen stars as Lt. Frank Bullitt in the role that made him a superstar as the hard-bitten police detective assigned to protect the star witness in a Congressional investigation. But when the witness is murdered, Bullitt mercilessly tracks a trail of lies and corruption that leads all the way to the halls of power in Washington. Steve McQueen performed his own stunts, driving the Ford Mustang in the high-speed pursuit through San Francisco that stands as one of the best and most famous car chases ever filmed.", ']]>'] Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama, Mystery & Suspense/Crime, Mystery & Suspense', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dubbed, Full Screen, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': "Norman Fell, Robert Duvall, Don Gordon, Robert Relyea, Steve McQueen, Georg Stanford Brown, Philip D'Antoni, Felice Orlandi, Jacqueline Bisset, Carl Reindel, Peter Yates, Vic Tayback, Simon Oakland, Justin Tarr, Robert VaughnNorman Fell, Robert Duvall, Don Gordon, Robert Relyea, Steve McQueen, Georg Stanford Brown, Philip D'Antoni, Felice Orlandi, Jacqueline Bisset, Carl Reindel, Peter Yates, Vic Tayback, Simon Oakland, Justin Tarr, Robert Vaughn See more", 'Language': 'French (Dolby Digital 1.0), English (Dolby Digital 4.0), Spanish (Mono)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 54 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '164748', 'Director': 'Peter Yates', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dubbed, Full Screen, NTSC, Widescreen, Subtitled', 'Run time': '1 hour and 54 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 5, 2010', 'Actors': 'Steve McQueen, Robert Vaughn, Jacqueline Bisset, Don Gordon, Robert Duvall', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, English, French', 'Producers': "Philip D'Antoni, Robert Relyea", 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: What can I say about Bullitt, one of the best Steve McQueen movies of all time. I know many people like his Great Escape, and so do I, but this movie has it all. Romance, intrigue and a fantastic car chase!!! Especially because it was set in San Francisco, what a place for a car chase. The next best is our modern day "Ronin", but that's a different kind of chase. It's set in Europe, where the street are super narrow. This movie, Bullit, is a great cop movie also. So if by chance you've missed it, it needs to go on your must see list.
Carolyn Gleeson- Lover of Steve McQueen movies in any form. In fact if you like Steve, see his motorcycle documentary,"On any Sunday". Unbelievable!!! Review Title: Bullitt- must see for car buffs! Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

profile:
**User Summary:**

The user exhibits a strong preference for classic action and adventure films, particularly those featuring iconic actors like Steve McQueen. Their enthusiasm for movies is evident, as they express deep admiration for character-driven narratives that combine elements of romance, intrigue, and thrilling car chases. The user enjoys the cinematic experience of high-octane pursuits, especially those set in unique locations like San Francisco.

They specifically appreciate films with high production value, notable stunt work, and well-crafted suspense, indicating a penchant for quality storytelling. Their favorable rating of the movie signifies an inclination to enjoy and endorse films that resonate with them, leading them to recommend must-see titles to others.

Additionally, the user demonstrates interest in both classic and modern films, referencing contemporary titles with similar themes while valuing the originals. Overall, they are positioned as a passionate film enthusiast, with a particular affinity for the works of Steve McQueen and comparable cinematic experiences.
